api_contracts.description: Returns a simple greeting message with HTTP 200 status code

component_logic.responsibility: Initialize and configure the FastAPI HTTP server framework with routing infrastructure

interfaces.description: Create and return a configured FastAPI application instance
Start the HTTP server on specified host and port

component_logic.implementation_notes: Use FastAPI 0.104+ to create the application instance. Configure with title='Hello World API' and version='1.0.0'. Use uvicorn as the ASGI server (uvicorn 0.24+). Default host should be '127.0.0.1' and port 8000. Enable automatic OpenAPI documentation generation (default behavior). Configure logging to output startup messages.

component_logic.responsibility: Handle GET /hello requests and return serialized JSON response with greeting message

interfaces.description: Handle GET /hello request and return greeting message as JSON

component_logic.implementation_notes: Register route handler using FastAPI @app.get('/hello') decorator. Return dictionary with key 'message' and value 'Hello World'. FastAPI automatically serializes to JSON with Content-Type: application/json. Handler must be synchronous function (no async required for this simple case). Ensure response status code is 200 (default for GET success).

component_logic.responsibility: Format HTTP responses with appropriate status codes and content-type headers

interfaces.description: Format successful response data with 200 status code
Format error response with appropriate status code and error details

component_logic.implementation_notes: Use FastAPI's JSONResponse for explicit response control. Success responses return status_code=200 with Content-Type: application/json. Error responses return appropriate HTTP status codes (500 for internal errors). Include error_code and message fields in error responses. FastAPI handles serialization automatically via Pydantic models or dicts. Ensure all responses include proper Content-Type headers (application/json).

design_review_checklist.description: Verify HTTP server framework is properly initialized and routing is configured
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: HTTPServerFramework.create_app() must return a valid FastAPI instance. FastAPI app must have @app.get('/hello') route registered. Server must start without errors on specified host and port.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify route handler is correctly mapped to GET /hello endpoint
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: HelloRouteHandler.hello() must be decorated with @app.get('/hello'). HTTP GET requests to /hello must invoke this handler. No other HTTP methods (POST, PUT, DELETE) should be allowed on this endpoint.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify response formatting handles both success and error cases
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: Success responses must return status 200 with JSON body containing 'message': 'Hello World'. Error responses must return status 500 with error_code and message fields. All responses must have Content-Type: application/json header.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify response serialization is efficient and uses FastAPI's built-in JSON handling
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: HelloRouteHandler must return plain dict (not Pydantic model) for simplicity. FastAPI must automatically serialize to JSON. No manual JSON encoding required. Response time should be < 10ms.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify response message is exactly 'Hello World' with correct casing and spacing
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: Response JSON must contain exactly: {"message": "Hello World"}. Message value must be string type. No extra fields or modifications to message content.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify semantic unit dependencies are correctly implemented
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: SU-001 (HTTPServerFramework) must be implemented before SU-002 (HelloRouteHandler). SU-002 must depend on SU-001. SU-003 (ResponseFormatter) must be used by SU-002 for response formatting. No circular dependencies.

architecture_overview: Simple three-tier architecture for a minimal HTTP API. HTTPServerFramework (SU-001) initializes FastAPI and configures the ASGI server. HelloRouteHandler (SU-002) registers the GET /hello route and delegates response formatting. ResponseFormatter (SU-003) handles JSON serialization and HTTP status codes. Request flow: HTTP GET /hello → FastAPI routing → HelloRouteHandler.hello() → ResponseFormatter.format_success_response() → JSON response with status 200. No database, caching, or external dependencies required.
assumptions: FastAPI is installed and available in the Python environment
uvicorn ASGI server is used to run the application
Server runs on localhost (127.0.0.1) port 8000 by default
No authentication or authorization is required for the /hello endpoint
Response must be JSON format with Content-Type: application/json
HTTP status code 200 is returned for successful requests
No request body or query parameters are required for GET /hello
No database or persistent storage is required
Application runs in a single process (no clustering or load balancing)
